data.title: Oliver Parker Movie Reviews & Previews
data.meta_description: Read Movie and TV reviews from Oliver Parker on Rotten Tomatoes, where critics reviews are aggregated to tally a Certified Fresh, Fresh or Rotten Tomatometer score.
data.text:
44%

Outlaw Posse (2024) This lightly radical framing helps cover some of the film's formal sins, casting its low-budget aesthetic as more charming than not and keeping the proceedings solidly entertaining for undemanding viewers interested in the Western genre. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Mar 02, 2024

94%

The Monk and the Gun (2023) While the film is certainly humorous throughout...the satire is never biting enough to actually make any decisive statement on the notions of democracy, capitalism, and whether the people of Bhutan actually need either. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Feb 05, 2024

85%

She Is Conann (2023) While She is Conann is unabashedly and appealingly a gender-flipped, queer version of the traditionally hyper-masculine tale, it isn't only that: it's a complete contortion of what a fantasy film can be. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Jan 31, 2024

--

Abbé Pierre – A Century of Devotion (2023) Tellier fumbles this poorly paced, repetitive film by indulging narrative loops that quickly wear you down and result in more of a boring slog than a captivating portrait of Pierre’s political and spiritual struggles. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Jun 05, 2023

92%

The Fishbowl (2023) In general, the film lacks the stillness necessary to land with impact, surprising given the narrative; it only runs 90 minutes, but still feels frustratingly lacking in intent. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Feb 27, 2023

84%

Let It Be Morning (2021) The film’s fundamental flaw... is that the comedy isn’t particularly effective and doesn’t have enough bite to feel genuinely insightful or provocative. - In Review Online

Read More | Posted Feb 10, 2023
